meanings.definition: The act of combining parts or elements to form a whole.
meanings.sent1: In art class, we learned about the composition of colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: The composition of ingredients in the recipe made the cake delicious.
meanings.sent3: The composition of the puzzle pieces was so tricky that it took hours to complete.
meanings.sent4: The composition of the team's players was like a puzzle coming together perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The composition of the music was so harmonious that it brought tears to my eyes.

meanings.definition: The structure or arrangement of elements in a work of art or literature.
meanings.sent1: The composition of the photograph captured the beauty of the sunset perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The composition of the novel was so engaging that I couldn't put it down.
meanings.sent3: The composition of the play was like a well-orchestrated dance on stage.
meanings.sent4: The composition of the poem painted a vivid picture in the reader's mind.
meanings.sent5: The composition of the painting drew me in with its intricate details.

meanings.definition: A written work, especially one that is academic or creative in nature.
meanings.sent1: Her composition for the school magazine won first place in the competition.
meanings.sent2: The composition she wrote for the music class was both creative and expressive.
meanings.sent3: The composition of her essay was so well-structured that it impressed the teacher.
meanings.sent4: His composition of the short story was like a journey through a magical world.
meanings.sent5: The composition of the research paper was thorough and well-researched.
